task_description: Facing the building to your North (approx. 12°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To estimate the building's height, I need to see its full vertical extent; looking up will reveal the roofline for accurate measurement.
I need to see the building's base to measure from ground level; rotating down will reveal the foundation for accurate height calculation.

Having observed both the roofline (at +30° pitch) and foundation (at -30° pitch), the total vertical angle spans 60°; using standard building proportions and typical viewing distance, the height is estimated as 24 meters.
